Package ru.nubowski.timeTracker.repository

Interface TimeLogRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<TimeLog,Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<TimeLog,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<TimeLog,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<TimeLog,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<TimeLog,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<TimeLog>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<TimeLog,Long>
public interface TimeLogRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<TimeLog,Long>
TimeLogRepository is an interface for performing database operations on TimeLog entities. It extends Spring Data JPA JpaRepository, gaining methods like save(), findAll(), and findById().

    • findTST

      @Query("SELECT t FROM TimeLog t WHERE t.task.user = :user AND ((t.startTime < :end AND t.endTime > :start) OR (t.endTime is NULL AND t.startTime < :end))") List<TimeLog> findTST(User user, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end)
      Deprecated method. Please refer to getTotalWorkEffortInSeconds(java.lang.Long, java.time.LocalDateTime, java.time.LocalDateTime) instead.

    • getTotalWorkEffortInSeconds

      @Query(value="SELECT SUM(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (LEAST(COALESCE(t.end_time, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP), :end) - GREATEST(t.start_time, :start)))) FROM time_logs t INNER JOIN tasks task ON t.task_id = task.id WHERE task.user_id = :user_id AND ((t.start_time < :end AND t.end_time > :start) OR (t.end_time IS NULL AND t.start_time < :end)) HAVING SUM(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (LEAST(COALESCE(t.end_time, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP), :end) - GREATEST(t.start_time, :start)))) > 0", nativeQuery=true) Long getTotalWorkEffortInSeconds(@Param("user_id") Long id, @Param("start") LocalDateTime start, @Param("end") LocalDateTime end)
      Fetches the total work effort in seconds by a user within a specified time range. This query uses native SQL for performance and data transfer reason reasons ^-^
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the user.
      start - The start of the time range.
      end - The end of the time range.
      Returns:
      The total work effort in seconds.
